intro: Cymopterus utahensis var. eastwoodiae, commonly known as the Utah evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The species is noted for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
